snippet: Mullah Akhtar Muhammad Mansour, the Taliban’s new leader, declared that “jihad would continue” in Afghanistan in an audio recording released Saturday, though his message contained signs of hope for the Afghan government and Western diplomats.
abstract: Taliban releases audio recording, allegedly from group's new leader Mullah Akhtar Muhammad Mansour, in which he vows to continue jihad until establishment of Islamic state in Afghanistan; recording is released shortly after Taliban confirms death of supreme commander Mullah Muammad Omar.

byline.contributor: Fazal Muzhary contributed reporting from Kabul, and Taimoor Shah from Kandahar, Afghanistan.

lead_paragraph: Mullah Akhtar Muhammad Mansour, the Taliban’s new leader, declared that “jihad would continue” in Afghanistan in an audio recording released Saturday, though his message contained signs of hope for the Afghan government and Western diplomats.

headline.main: Taliban Leader Urges Unity, Playing Down Peace Talk
headline.print_headline: Taliban’s New Leader Urges Unity, Playing Down Peace Talk
